issues.description: The problem statement specifies that fix_vec_dot should return void and store the result via a third argument pointer, but both the template and solution implementations define fix_vec_dot_asm to take only two arguments (v1 and v2) and return the scalar result in EDX:EAX. This mismatch in expected parameters will block students from following the specification.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the template and solution to accept a third argument (output pointer) and write the dot product result there (with a void return), or change the problem statement to specify the two-argument signature and returning a 64-bit result in EDX:EAX.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies the function name as `fix_vec_dot`, but both the template stub and the solution implement/use `fix_vec_dot_asm`. This mismatch may confuse students when they look for the stub to complete or call the function described in the problem.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the problem statement to refer to `fix_vec_dot_asm`, or rename the stub and global symbol in the template (and solution) from `fix_vec_dot_asm` to `fix_vec_dot` to keep the name consistent.
